posts.post_content: This card isn't a game breaker, but the 2/2 cat token can be really good, it doesn't specify damage opponent just has to attack. You could play it with the leonin that gives all cats +1 and get even better cat tokens. Use lush growth on an opponents land to make it a forest.

Posted By: Meteorain27 (1/21/2010 8:09:12 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
One of my favorites :D  
Cat tribal is seriously under-rated. This, [Lush Growth](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Lush Growth) on an opponents land, [Raksha, Golden Cub](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Raksha, Golden Cub) equipped with [Konda's Banner](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Konda's Banner). My god, man. You've got a an 9/9 unblockable double striking kitty generating 6/6 unblockable double strikers. And Ol' Raksha on the side.  
  
Like anything else in Magic ever... [Doubling Season](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Doubling Season) makes it more ridiculous.  
Why not [Oran-Rief, the Vastwood](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Oran-Rief, the Vastwood), too?  
  
Kill, kill, kill!
posts.html:

Like anything else in Magic ever... Doubling Season makes it more ridiculous.
Why not Oran-Rief, the Vastwood, too?

Kill, kill, kill!

Actually it would only be generating 5/5 unblockable doublestriking tokens (can you believe that statement actually had an "only" in it). +2/+2 from Raksha, and since the tokens are green and Raksha is white, the Banner only gives them +1/+1 for sharing a creature type.

Posted By: Names_Suck (4/9/2011 9:51:49 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
With the Heroes of Mirrodin Besieged, specifically the white variation, Ojanen is a fantastic predecessor.
  
   
He's green and definitely greener, with a higher cost and more power/toughness. However, the two 1/1 tokens have manifested themselves here as a 2/2 cat.
  
   
With the Forest Walk and probably with a white Vigilance aura, this can effectively be made into something that produces better tokens than the hero, although it isn't much faster.
  
   
Another problem is that the hero's tokens come in attacking, although they only show up when it attacks: not when it blocks.
  
   
The major problem is that, there is very little powerful cat tribal that isn't reliant on equipment for all I'm aware of. As a consequence, those soldier tokens from the hero become more powerful more easily and more quickly.
  
   
   
Definitely average at least, good for a green mono or green/white tribal.
posts.html:
With the Heroes of Mirrodin Besieged, specifically the white variation, Ojanen is a fantastic predecessor.

He's green and definitely greener, with a higher cost and more power/toughness. However, the two 1/1 tokens have manifested themselves here as a 2/2 cat.

With the Forest Walk and probably with a white Vigilance aura, this can effectively be made into something that produces better tokens than the hero, although it isn't much faster.

Another problem is that the hero's tokens come in attacking, although they only show up when it attacks: not when it blocks.

The major problem is that, there is very little powerful cat tribal that isn't reliant on equipment for all I'm aware of. As a consequence, those soldier tokens from the hero become more powerful more easily and more quickly.


Definitely average at least, good for a green mono or green/white tribal.

Posted By: theblackknight42 (12/9/2011 8:24:46 AM)

posts.post_content:
@Meteorain27 : Spot on! I have a deck with 4 of Yavimaya Dryads and 2 Jedit Ojanen (those are the only ones I've managed to pull in a draft + booster buys).  
It's very fun in casual, since there's risk involved. The opponent has the feeling that you're donating him the land, whereas you're in fact baiting him to trigger the Forestwalkers.  
High risk, high reward.  
Just how I love it :)
posts.html:
@Meteorain27 : Spot on! I have a deck with 4 of Yavimaya Dryads and 2 Jedit Ojanen (those are the only ones I've managed to pull in a draft + booster buys).
It's very fun in casual, since there's risk involved. The opponent has the feeling that you're donating him the land, whereas you're in fact baiting him to trigger the Forestwalkers.
High risk, high reward.
Just how I love it :)
